quizzes.title: History Quiz: Battle and Osama Bin Laden
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, terrorists, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The first major act of terrorism attributed to bin Ladens al-Qaeda group was in 1998 when it blew up which of these?

options.text: U.S. embassies in Tanzania and Kenya
Khobar Towers housing complex in Dhahran, Saudi Arabia
a parking garage of the World Trade Center

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: U.S. embassies in Tanzania and Kenya

questions.question: At what battle of the American Civil War did Native American forces first participate in military action?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pea Ridge

questions.question: There were more people killed at Pearl Harbor on December 7, 1941 than there were some 60 years later in the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What Union naval ship sank Confederate raider CSS Alabama during the American Civil War?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: USS Kearsarge

questions.question: In 1996, U.S. anti-terrorist investigators learned of an organization called al-Qaeda for the very first time from which one of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sudanese informer

questions.question: What country did Osama bin Laden live in and operate al-Qaeda from before he found sanctuary back in Afghanistan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sudan

questions.question: What was Ulysses S. Grants first battle, fought against Confederate General Gideon J. Pillow?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Belmont

questions.question: How many days before 9/11 did George W. Bush receive a Presidents Daily Brief intelligence report entitled Bin Laden Determined to Strike in U.S.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 35 days

questions.question: At what battle of the American Civil War did Generals U.S. Grant, William T. Sherman, George H. Thomas, and Joseph Hooker all fight at once?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chattanooga

questions.question: Osama bin Laden is a striking figure, well over six feet tall.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who commanded the Union cavalry corps at the battle of Gettysburg?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alfred Pleasanton

questions.question: Who was the first official casualty of the American Civil War?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pvt. Daniel Hough

questions.question: In April, 2004, then-National Security Advisor Condoleezza Rice told the 9/11 Commission: I do not remember any reports to us, a kind of strategic warning, that planes might be used as weapons.  What fact refutes Dr. Rices statement?

options.text: A year before 9/11, the CIA briefed President Bush and the Cabinet about terrorists in flight school.
Rice had drafted her own memo about hijacking dangers before she served in the Bush administration.
A plot like this was depicted in the movie Top Gun.
Two years before 9/11, in an Air Force training exercise, jet pilots practiced shooting down a hijacked commercial aircraft before it could crash into civilian targets.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Two years before 9/11, in an Air Force training exercise, jet pilots practiced shooting down a hijacked commercial aircraft before it could crash into civilian targets.

questions.question: Osama bin Laden is the scion of a huge, wealthy, long-established Saudi Arabian clan.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: How many al-Qaeda terrorists were involved in the near-destruction of the $1billion guided-missile destroyer USS Cole, which was protected by some 70 tons of armor shielding?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2

quizzes.title: History Quiz: 1940s and Statement
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, metaphor, casualties. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which famous metaphor did Winston Churchill use in the 1940s to describe what Russia did to Eastern Europe after WWII?

options.text: The Russian Winter of  No Dissent.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Iron Curtain

questions.question: The 1945 Nobel Prize in Physiology and Medicine went to three men from Oxford University who played a significant role in the discovery and development of penicillin and its use as an antibiotic. Which of these scientists did not share this prize?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Winchell

questions.question: Where were the first shots of the American Revolutionary War fired?

options.text: near the city of New York

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lexington, Massachusetts

questions.question: What American product from the 50s was advertised with roadside signs reading slogans such as:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Burma Shave

questions.question: There was fighting in the Revolutionary War for more than a year before the United States declared independence from Britain.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which statement is untrue about Jackie Robinson, who broke the color barrier in professional baseball in 1947?

options.text: He also integrated the city of Stamford, Connecticut.
His older brother was considered the best athlete in the family but was forced to take a job as a sanitation worker in Los Angeles because of segregation.
He played three sports for UCLA.
When Walter Alston signed him, both Alston and Robinson received death threats.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: When Walter Alston signed him, both Alston and Robinson received death threats.

questions.question: In the 1940s the USA began  the Manhattan Project to build the first Atomic bomb. The first part of this project  was to split the atom. It was accomplished by a team led by great Enricco Fermi. Where was it done?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicago, Illinois.

questions.question: Which of these did not happen in 1941?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The microwave was invented

questions.question: Which statement is true about Pete Gray, who played outfield for the St. Louis Browns during World War II?

options.text: Gray was legally  blind in one  eye.
Gray was the only person to lead in home runs while playing for a last place  team.
During this period Gray was the only  player to hit 50 homers in one  year.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gray had only one arm.

questions.question: In 1942 there was a terrible ammonium nitrate explosion that killed 20 people. Where did it occur?

options.text: in the Atlantic Ocean on a cargo ship

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cleveland, Ohio

questions.question: What did Walter Morrison invent in 1948?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Frisbee

questions.question: Which of these events did not  occur in 1947?

options.text: The Dead Sea Scrolls are found.
Chuck Yeager breaks the sound barrier.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The United Nations is founded.

questions.question: Which is the most accurate number of casualties (including killed, wounded or lost) of World War II?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 16,354,000

questions.question: Which of the following proved to be the greatest obstacle to saving lives in New York Citys 9/11 rescue efforts at the World Trade Center towers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: outdated fire department radios

questions.question: What term refers to the body of delegates from the colonies who met during the Revolutionary War until a constitutional government was finally formed near the end of the war?

options.text: the Executive Committee of the United States
the Congress of the United Colonies

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Continental Congress

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Pet and Plane
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, john, -1902. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This 1899 -1902 war marked the beginning of the decline of the British Empire
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Boer War - South Africa

questions.question: Where would you be if you heard Tattoo yell out,  Ze plane!  Ze plane!
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fantasy Island

questions.question: In 1853 the Crimean War began.  Which country was not part of the coalition against Russia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Austria

questions.question: Ever since the Napoleonic wars, conscript troops were blamed for a lack of professionalism and could not be trusted. However, this changed at the 1866 battle at...?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Koniggratz

questions.question: In 1905 the Russian fleet engaged the Japanese fleet in front of the Korean coast. In order to reach Korea, the Russian fleet had to cross half of the world from their western ports. Believing they were battling Japanese torpedo boats in the North Sea, the Russian fleet mistakenly attacked British fishing ships.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: We may have not known the meaning of

options.text: t we could figure out the meaning of

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lady Marmalade

questions.question: The American victory in this battle is often called the turning point of the Revolutionary War in the South.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Battle of Kings Mountain

questions.question: What statement is true about the Treaty of Paris of 1783?

options.text: It granted territory to the US from the Atlantic Ocean to the Pacific Ocean.
It formed a permanent alliance between France and the US.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It recognized US independence.

questions.question: Why is July 4th, 1776 considered the birthday of the United States?

options.text: because the signing of the Declaration of Independence began on that day
because on that day the British recognized US independence
because on that day all thirteen former colonies finally agreed to a constitution for their new government
because on that day the Americans had their first victory over the British at Boston

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: because the signing of the Declaration of Independence began on that day

questions.question: Stormd at with shot and shell,
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lord Cardigan

questions.question: How did the French aid the American patriots during the Revolutionary War?

options.text: by allowing the French fleet to aid the Americans at a critical point of the war
by providing substantial amounts of military supplies
by sending part of the French Army to America

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: all of these

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT true about the Battle of Saratoga in 1777?

options.text: It was the first major victory for the Americans.
The American victory convinced the French to give the Americans substantial aid.
British General Burgoyne invading from Canada lost his entire army.
General George Washington was wounded while directing the American troops.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: General George Washington was wounded while directing the American troops.

questions.question: The pros:  this pet needed no watering, feeding, worming or grooming.  You could go on a six month vacation and never have to ask your neighbor to take care of this pet.  The cons:  this pet could only learn how to stay and  was very, very boring.  Thanks to Gary Dahl, what pet sold over 1,000,000 in 1975?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pet Rock

questions.question: What statement is true about John Paul Jones who fought in the American Revolutionary War?

options.text: He used guerrilla warfare against the British.
He was able to get several Indian tribes to fight against the British.
He was successful in naval warfare against the British.
He captured several British forts in Canada.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was successful in naval warfare against the British.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a quote from Saturday Night Live?

options.text: We are two wild and crazy guys!
Im Chevy Chase and youre not.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nanoo nanoo!

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Place and Conflict
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, people, june. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This conflict lead to the start of a period which is referred to as The Catastrophe by the defeated. Which conflict is this?

options.text: The Soviet Annexation of the Baltic States; Estonia, Lithuania  Latvia - 1940

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Arab-Israel War - 1948

questions.question: What happened at Prokhorovka on July 12th, 1943?

options.text: The biggest infantry engagement of WW II
The biggest Tank batlle of WW II

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The biggest Tank batlle of WW II

questions.question: When and where did the Velvet Revolution take place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1989 ; Prague ; Czechoslovakia

questions.question: This Civil War raged between 1967 - 1970, costing an estimated 1 million people their lives. In the aftermath the Non-Governmental Organization Medicins sans Frontiere was created in 1971. In which country did this civil war take place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nigeria

questions.question: In 1861 Italy was finally (largely) unified with Victor Emmanuel II assuming the title of King of Italy. Who became the first Prime Minister of Italy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Camillo di Cavour

questions.question: On September 27th, 1779 this politician was appointed by American Congress to start negotiating peace with the British.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Adams

questions.question: What is the War of Laws?

options.text: The Iraqis democratic government attempt to get an acceptable constitution
ANCs attempt to change the discrimination laws in South Africas Apartheid regime
The EU attempt to override local Member State law
The implementation of National legislation laws vs. Soviet Union laws

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The implementation of National legislation laws vs. Soviet Union laws

questions.question: In June 1812, Napoleon Bonaparte and his Grand Armee suddenly invaded Russia at Nemel. After victories at Smolensk and Borodino, Napoleon managed to conquer Moscow without a fight. It was the start of the end of his army. After Russian refusals to come to terms and a big fire in Moscow, Napoleon was forced to retreat. The retreat turned into a complete disaster when crossing the Berezina river in November 1812. At what place did this crossing take place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Studjanka

questions.question: July 1969 will go into history as the month man first set foot on the Moon. However, in that same month and year another momentous event took place. Which event was that?

options.text: The Beatles give their last public performance
A coup in Libya brings to power Colonel Khadaffi

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Nixon Doctrine is declared

questions.question: The United Islamic Front for the Salvation of Afghanistan is also known as?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Northern Alliance

questions.question: During his lifetime Montesquieu (1689 -1755) was an outright critic of the French Absolutism. He put this forward in books like Lettres Persanes (Persian Letters - 1721). He also developed his own view on an ideal political system which he described in his Lesprit des Lois (on the Spirit of Laws -1748). What political system was he envisioning?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Constitutional Monarchy

questions.question: This conflict ended in a humiliating defeat for China and forced the opening of 5 ports to international trade; Canton, Shanghai, Foochow, Ningpo, and Amoy. Which conflict was it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The first Opium War 1839 - 1842

questions.question: In 1876 the International Comittee of the Red Cross came into being. Which battle witnessed by one of the founders led to the foundation of the Red Cross?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The battle of Solferino June 24th, 1859

questions.question: Between 1639 and 1858 Japan was largely isolated from the outside world. The port of Nagasaki was only open to Dutch and Chinese ships. In 1858 Commander Perry forced the Japanese Shogun to stop preventing trade. What was one of the results of this event?

options.text: A rise to power of the Shogunate
The loss of Nagasaki to a foreign power

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Meiji Restoration

questions.question: On April 24th 1916 an uprising took place in this country in an attempt to gain independence from the UK.  Where did this uprising take place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ireland; The Easter Uprising

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Korean War and The Korean War
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, ground, line. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was the dividing line between North and South Korea after World War Two?

options.text: There was never any dividing line established.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the 38th parallel

questions.question: When did the Korean War begin?

options.text: in 1946, when Korean communist guerrillas began attacking non-communist groups throughout Korea
in 1949, when Chinese communists crossed the border into northern Korea and attempted to take over the entire nation
in 1953 when the US-backed South Korean army invaded communist North Korea
in 1950 when communist North Korea suddenly attacked non-communist South Korea

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: in 1950 when communist North Korea suddenly attacked non-communist South Korea

questions.question: After conquering the vast majority of Western Europe, early in  World War II, the German High Command ordered the construction of a string of fortifications known as the Atlantic Wall. Parts of these barrier systems included mines, barbed wire, casemates and imitation stones. What were these imitation stones?

options.text: Stone walls suggesting the presence of bunkers
Pointed stakes just under water level, to sink landing craft

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Camouflaged bunkers

questions.question: In 1944 the Allies launched Operation Overlord starting the liberation of Europe. When troops entered the beaches and caught their first prisoners, they were surprised to hear this language.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Russian

questions.question: In 1944 the Allies launched a very ambitious airborne and ground campaign into the Netherlands, codenamed Operation Market Garden.  Who was in direct charge of the 1st British Airborne Division?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maj. Gen. Urquhart

questions.question: During World war II, Singapores defenses were so strong that it was considered to be the Gibraltar of the Pacific. However the city fell to the Japanese relatively easy on February 15th 1942. What was the main reason for this?

options.text: The Japanese assaulted Singapore over land.
A night-time Amphibious assault caught the defenders off-guard.
Pro-Japanese resistance groups caused havoc in the city, leaving the defenders confused.
Superior Japanese Naval forces bombarded the defenders into submission.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Japanese assaulted Singapore over land.

questions.question: During the 1945 siege of Berlin by Russian forces, rumors spread among the German refugees in the Berlin Underground, that Russian T-34 tanks had entered the Underground.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Early in the Korean War, communist forces drove deep into South Korea until they were finally stopped at the perimeter surrounding this city near the southern end of Korea.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pusan

questions.question: Which statement regarding the consequences of the Korean War is true?

options.text: When the war ended, China had gained some territory and special economic concessions from North Korea.
When the war ended, the South had gained a large part of North Korean territory.
When the war ended, the North had gained a large part of South Korean territory.
When the war ended, no nation made any significant gain in territory or economic concessions. The dividing line between North and South was almost the same as when the war began.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: When the war ended, no nation made any significant gain in territory or economic concessions. The dividing line between North and South was almost the same as when the war began.

questions.question: What was the objective of Operation Hailstone that was launched in 1944 by the United States Navy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Attack on Truk Atoll

questions.question: During World War II V-2 Rockets were never aimed at targets outside the UK.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: During the Korean War, why was General MacArthur fired as commander of the anti-communist forces in Korea by the President (who is also commander-in-chief of US armed forces)?

options.text: MacArthur refused to attack Chinese bases in China.
MacArthur publicly disagreed with the Presidents policy of limited war in Korea.
The American public demanded a more effective commander.
MacArthur refused to cooperate with NATO forces.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: MacArthur publicly disagreed with the Presidents policy of limited war in Korea.

questions.question: During the Korean War, after stopping the original communist invasion the anti-communist forces, commanded by General MacArthur, steadily drove the North Koreans back deep into North Korea. Then the war had a new development as Communist Chinese forces attacked in force. What is the most probable reason why the Chinese decided to enter the war?

options.text: MacArthurs air forces bombed communist supply bases in China.
The Chinese saw this as a chance to defeat the Americans and invade Japan.
Anti-communist forces crossed over the North Korean-China border in several places.
MacArthurs aggressive policies and proclamations made the Chinese fear that they themselves might be attacked by the anti-communist forces.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: MacArthurs aggressive policies and proclamations made the Chinese fear that they themselves might be attacked by the anti-communist forces.

questions.question: Who was US President during most of the Korean War?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Truman

questions.question: Which statement is true about the Chinese entry into the Korean War?

options.text: It caused the Nationalist forces of Taiwan to enter the war against Communist China.
It led to US bombing of targets in China.
It pushed the anti-communist forces back rapidly all the way into South Korea.
It had little effect on the course of the war.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It pushed the anti-communist forces back rapidly all the way into South Korea.

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: June and Codename
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, codename, husky. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who assassinated Austrian Archduke Franz Ferdinand and his wife on June 28, 1914?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gavrilo Princip

questions.question: How did the Greeks overtake the city of Troy during the Trojan War?

options.text: They used a wooden hollow horse.
They destroyed the walls of the city.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They used a wooden hollow horse.

questions.question: What was the codename for the amphibious assault on Normandy, France on 6 June 1944?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neptune

questions.question: What holiday was first celebrated on June 19, 1910?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fathers Day

questions.question: What president signed legislation providing for an 8-hour work-day applicable to federal employees on June 25, 1868?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andrew Johnson

questions.question: What was the objective of Operation Husky launched in 1943?

options.text: The bombardment of the Monte Casino Cloister
The final defeat of German forces in Africa

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The capture of Sicily

questions.question: In Greek mythology, Patroclus donned Achilles armor to fight against the Trojans and was killed by Hector.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What cartoon character made his film debut on June 9, 1934?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Donald Duck

questions.question: In May 1941 the Germans used airborne divisions to invade the Island of Crete. Who was the commander of these forces?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: General Kurt Student

questions.question: On June 21, 1788 the US Constitution became the law of the land when ratified by New Hampshire.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This corporation, initially known as the Computing-Tabulating-Recording Company, was incorporated on June 15, 1911.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: IBM

questions.question: Who assassinated Robert F. Kennedy on June 5, 1968?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sirhan Sirhan

questions.question: Who was the first horse to claim the United States Triple Crown of Thoroughbred Racing on June 11, 1919?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sir Barton

questions.question: Scythian monk Dennis the Little, who lived in the sixth century invented this.

options.text: Numbering years according to the life of Jesus

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Numbering years according to the life of Jesus

questions.question: What soap opera moved from radio to television on June 30, 1952?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guiding Light
